column5: A lot of boats have the option now for C/D players. I know most go up to the lakes for peace and quiet, right! I know of some that will listen to the Rolling Stones while they're fishing. Any thoughts on this?

Hi. Well its like this, sometimes you feel like a nut and sometimes you dont! Its nice to have the option. there are no radio stations to speak of in canada so sometimes its nice to have something. My wife brings along books on CDs and plays them while we fish. Its nice to have it if you want it.

>A lot of boats have the option now for C/D players. I know >most go up to the lakes for peace and quiet, right! I know of >some that will listen to the Rolling Stones while they're >fishing. Any thoughts on this?
We were On Lac Seul last summer listening to a little Kenney Chesney when my dad pulled in a 29"er. Nice quiet night. Must've been a Kenney fan.
Either a Kenny fan or the country music drove him to the point of commiting suicide! ;) Tim
I agree, that fish wanted to die after listening to that crap. I have switched to a satellite radio in the boat, I've used it as far north as Kenora.
your to old if it is too loud. Or so my kids tell me
if you come by me I'd leave... take your CD player and listen to it in the car, the lake should stay quite
>if you come by me I'd leave... > >take your CD player and listen to it in the car, the lake >should stay quite HERE, HERE!!!!

Forget CD player - get Sirius Satellite Radio and listen to commercial free music 24/7! Brought mine to Quebec last week - made the drive so much better. Listening in the cabin was great and wished I had it in the boat (have to wait for the next boat)!
